III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The facility does not serve clients from the plaintiff class that fall under the
Modified Implementation, Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP).
3.) The facility does not have a contract with the department.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 Ensure all references are dated.
 For proof of education an official transcript or copy of the degree is needed.
 Proofread all sections of the treatment plans to ensure all information is
correct.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility was required to submit once acceptable corrective action plan not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
Special Investigation 2021C0103017 was initiated when it was reported that a staff
member touched a youth inappropriately and would allow the youth to touch the staff.
The youth also ran away from the facility and went to the staff member’s house.
There was not sufficient evidence to indicate the staff inappropriately touched the
youth however the staff member did have poor boundaries with the youth so the
facility was found in violation of R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
requirements; staff qualification. This violation was due to the staff member not
having the ability and/or experience to perform the duties of the job. A Corrective
Action plan was accepted on 6/22/21.
4

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
